title: What is passive voice biometric verification? - Quora

response.answer_text: Passive voice biometric verification is a type of verification that authenticates a person based on their voice regardless of what they are saying. This type of voice biometric verification can also be called as: Passwordless voice biometric verificationLanguage-independent voice biometric verificationFree speech voice biometric verificationText-independent voice biometric verificationAll of the above have a common denominator—a person can speak freely without a need for saying a specific word, sentence, or phrase. The main advantage of passive voice biometric verification is that it greatly improves the Customer Experience (CX) and increases authentication security as the person is not required to remember (and say) any password. Thus, passwords cannot be eavesdropped, and the person can speak straight to the point (e.g., to a call center operator). Passive voice biometric verification is a crucial piece of the puzzle for the voice-first future where people’s preferred way of interaction with smart devices will be through voice. An example of a state-of-the-art free speech voice verification solution for call centers is Phonexia Voice Verify.
